data.title: 2024 Golden Globes Winners: Ayo Edebiri, Da’Vine Joy Randolph Take Home Gold
data.meta_description: Golden Globes 2024 winners include a bevy of new age stars such as Ayo Edebiri, Da’Vine Joy Randolph, Steven Yuen and more.
data.text:
The 2024 Golden Globes aired on Sunday (Jan. 7) at The Beverly Hilton in Beverly Hills, Calif. Comedian Jo Koy hosted the ceremony, which was heavily dominated by nominations for Barbie and Succession. The special night also highlighted the industry’s slate of modern stars.

Some of entertainment’s latest gems, such as Steven Yuen, Da’Vine Joy Randolph, and Ayo Edebiri took home accolades for their show-stopping performances. Edebiri even went viral on social media for her Sydney-esque acceptance speech.

“There’s so many people who I probably forgot to thank—oh my God! Oh my God! All of my agents and managers’ assistants! The people who answer my emails!” she exclaimed. “Y’all are real ones! Thank you for answering my crazy, crazy emails.”

The 2024 edition of the Golden Globes also marked the first time the Hollywood Foreign Press Association wasn’t involved in the show. According to the Hollywood Reporter, a new diversity board consisting of 300 journalists worldwide selected 2024’s winners.

Here is the list of winners from this year’s ceremony.

Best Performance by a Female Actor in a Television Series – Musical or Comedy

Rachel Brosnahan, The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel

Quinta Brunson, Abbott Elementary

Ayo Edebiri, The Bear (WINNER)

Elle Fanning, The Great

Selena Gomez, Only Murders in the Building

Natasha Lyonne, Poker Face

Best Performance by a Male Actor in a Television Series – Musical or Comedy

Bill Hader, Barry

Steve Martin, Only Murders in the Building

Jason Segel, Shrinking

Martin Short, Only Murders in the Building

Jason Sudeikis, Ted Lasso

Jeremy Allen White, The Bear (WINNER)

Best Performance by a Female Actor in a Limited Series, Anthology Series or a Motion Picture Made for Television

Riley Keough, Daisy Jones & the Six

Brie Larson, Lessons in Chemistry

Elizabeth Olsen, Love & Death

Juno Temple, Fargo

Rachel Weisz, Dead Ringers

Ali Wong, Beef (WINNER)

Best Performance by a Male Actor in a Limited Series, Anthology Series or a Motion Picture Made for Television

Matt Bomer, Fellow Travelers

Sam Claflin, Daisy Jones & the Six

Jon Hamm, Fargo

Woody Harrelson, White House Plumbers

David Oyelowo, Lawmen: Bass Reeves

Steven Yeun, Beef (WINNER)

Best Performance by a Male Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama

Bradley Cooper, Maestro

Leonardo DiCaprio, Killers of the Flower Moon

Cillian Murphy, Oppenheimer (WINNER)

Colman Domingo, Rustin

Barry Keoghan, Saltburn

Andrew Scott, All of Us Strangers

Best Performance by a Female Actor in a Motion Picture – Drama

Annette Bening, Nyad

Sandra Hüller, Anatomy of a Fall

Greta Lee, Past Lives

Carey Mulligan, Maestro

Cailee Spaeny, Priscilla

Lily Gladstone, Killers of the Flower Moon (WINNER)

Best Performance by a Female Actor in a Motion Picture – Musical or Comedy

Emma Stone, Poor Things (WINNER)

Fantasia Barrino, The Color Purple

Jennifer Lawrence, No Hard Feelings

Natalie Portman, May December

Alma Pöysti, Fallen Leaves

Timothée Chalamet, Wonka

Paul Giamatti, The Holdovers (WINNER)

Willem Dafoe, Poor Things

Robert De Niro, Killers of the Flower Moon

Ryan Gosling, Barbie

Charles Melton, May December

Robert Downey Jr., Oppenheimer (WINNER)

Danielle Brooks, The Color Purple

Julianne Moore, May December

Rosamund Pike, Saltburn

Da’Vine Joy Randolph, The Holdovers (WINNER)

Anatomy of a Fall (Neon)

Maestro (Netflix)

Oppenheimer (Universal Pictures) (WINNER)

Past Lives (A24)

The Zone of Interest (A24)

The Holdovers (Focus Features)

May December (Netflix)

Poor Things (Searchlight Pictures) (WINNER)

The Super Mario Bros. Movie (Universal Pictures)

Mission: Impossible – Dead Reckoning Part One (Paramount Pictures)

Oppenheimer (Universal Pictures)

Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse (Sony Pictures Releasing)

“Road to Freedom,” Rustin, Music and lyrics by Lenny Kravitz

1923 (Paramount+)

Helen Mirren, 1923

Bella Ramsey, The Last of Us

Keri Russell, The Diplomat

Imelda Staunton, The Crown

Emma Stone, The Curse

Gary Oldman, Slow Horses

Pedro Pascal, The Last of Us

Jeremy Strong, Succession

Dominic West, The Crown

Kieran Culkin, Succession (WINNER)

Wanda Sykes, Wanda Sykes: I’m an Entertainer
